farming_practices.name: Summer Deep Ploughing
farming_practices.description: Deep ploughing (20-25 cm depth) during April-May after Rabi harvest. Exposes subsoil to sun, kills hibernating pests and pupae, breaks hard pan, and improves water infiltration. Essential practice for Telangana's red and black soils.
benefits: Breaks hard pan in red soils
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Raised Bed Farming
farming_practices.description: Creating raised beds of 90-120 cm width with furrows for drainage. Ideal for Telangana's black cotton soils that are prone to waterlogging. Reduces seed rot, improves root development, and allows better drainage during heavy monsoon rains.
farming_practices.region: Black soil areas: Adilabad, Nizamabad, Karimnagar, Medak

farming_practices.name: System of Rice Intensification (SRI)
farming_practices.description: Transplanting single young seedlings (8-12 days old) at wider spacing (25x25 cm) with alternate wetting and drying irrigation. Proven to increase yield by 20-30% with 30-40% less water in Telangana. Promoted by PJTSAU.
benefits: Reduced seed rate (2 kg/acre vs 25 kg)
Stronger root system and more tillers
farming_practices.region: All Telangana rice-growing districts: Warangal, Nizamabad, Karimnagar, Khammam

farming_practices.name: Drip Irrigation for Cotton
farming_practices.description: Installing drip irrigation system for cotton at 150 cm row spacing with inline drippers at 60 cm spacing. Saves 40-50% water compared to flood irrigation. Government subsidy available under TMIP for micro-irrigation.
benefits: Fertigation possible for precise nutrient delivery
Subsidy up to 90% under TMIP for small farmers
farming_practices.region: Cotton-growing areas: Adilabad, Khammam, Nalgonda, Karimnagar

farming_practices.name: Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD) in Rice
farming_practices.description: Instead of continuous flooding, allow rice fields to dry until hairline cracks appear, then re-irrigate. Reduces water use by 20-30% without yield loss. Install a perforated pipe (field water tube) to monitor water level.
benefits: No yield penalty if managed properly
farming_practices.region: All irrigated rice areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Farm Pond (Rythu Kundam)
farming_practices.description: Digging a farm pond of 10x10x3 meters to collect and store rainwater runoff. Provides supplemental irrigation during dry spells. Government support available under Mission Kakatiya and MGNREGA. Critical for dryland farming in Telangana.
benefits: Fish culture possible as additional income
farming_practices.season: Year-round benefit, best constructed in summer
farming_practices.region: Rainfed areas: Mahbubnagar, Nalgonda, Wanaparthy, Nagarkurnool

farming_practices.name: Green Manuring with Dhaincha
farming_practices.description: Growing Sesbania aculeata (dhaincha) or Crotalaria juncea (sunhemp) for 45-60 days during pre-Kharif and incorporating into soil before main crop. Adds 25-30 kg nitrogen per acre. Essential for Telangana's nitrogen-deficient red soils.
benefits: Reduces need for chemical nitrogen by 25-30%
farming_practices.region: Red soil areas: Warangal, Nalgonda, Mahbubnagar, Rangareddy

farming_practices.name: Soil Testing and Balanced Fertilization
farming_practices.description: Getting soil tested from nearest Soil Testing Laboratory (available free under Soil Health Card scheme) and applying fertilizers based on recommendations. Most Telangana soils are deficient in nitrogen, phosphorus, zinc, and boron.
benefits: Free soil testing through government labs
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts - nearest Soil Testing Lab in each district

farming_practices.name: Vermicomposting
farming_practices.description: Producing nutrient-rich vermicompost from farm waste, cow dung, and crop residues using earthworms (Eisenia fetida). Each unit can produce 2-3 tonnes of vermicompost per year. Very suitable for Telangana's organic-matter-depleted red soils.
benefits: Improves soil structure and water retention
Additional income from selling surplus vermicompost
Government subsidy available for setting up units
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Gypsum Application for Black Soils
farming_practices.description: Applying gypsum (calcium sulphate) at 500-1000 kg per acre to alkaline black cotton soils. Improves soil structure, reduces crusting, enhances water infiltration, and provides calcium and sulphur nutrients.
benefits: Improves water infiltration in heavy soils
farming_practices.region: Black soil areas: Adilabad, Nizamabad, Karimnagar, Medak

farming_practices.name: Integrated Pest Management (IPM) in Cotton
farming_practices.description: Combining cultural, biological, and need-based chemical methods for pest management in cotton. Includes border crop of maize, bird perches, pheromone traps, Trichogramma releases, and targeted sprays only when pest crosses ETL.
farming_practices.region: All cotton-growing districts of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Seed Treatment Before Sowing
farming_practices.description: Treating seeds with fungicide (Carbendazim/Thiram), insecticide (Imidacloprid/Thiamethoxam), and bio-agent (Trichoderma viride) before sowing. Protects seedlings from soil-borne diseases and early pest damage.
benefits: Low cost and high benefit ratio
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts for all crops

farming_practices.name: Intercropping in Red Gram
farming_practices.description: Growing red gram (pigeon pea) as main crop with soybean, maize, or sorghum as intercrop in 1:2 or 1:3 ratio. Maximizes land use, provides early income from intercrop, and reduces pest/disease buildup.
farming_practices.region: Mahbubnagar, Nalgonda, Adilabad, Karimnagar

farming_practices.name: Mulching in Vegetable Cultivation
farming_practices.description: Using black or silver plastic mulch or paddy straw mulch for vegetable crops like tomato, chilli, and brinjal. Conserves soil moisture, suppresses weeds, reduces soil temperature fluctuation, and reflects light to deter whiteflies (silver mulch).
benefits: Reduced pest incidence with silver mulch
farming_practices.region: Vegetable-growing areas: Rangareddy, Mahbubnagar, Warangal, Medak

farming_practices.name: Staking and Training in Tomato
farming_practices.description: Supporting tomato plants with bamboo stakes or trellises to keep fruits off the ground. Improves air circulation (reduces disease), makes spraying effective, allows uniform ripening, and improves fruit quality.
benefits: Better air circulation reduces fungal diseases
Higher market price for clean fruits
farming_practices.region: All tomato-growing areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Thinning and Gap Filling
farming_practices.description: Removing excess seedlings to maintain optimal plant population and filling gaps where germination failed. Critical for crops like cotton (1 plant/hill), maize (1 plant/hill), and direct-seeded rice.
benefits: Optimal plant population for maximum yield
Reduced competition for nutrients and light
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Jeevamrutham Preparation
farming_practices.description: Preparing liquid bio-fertilizer from cow dung (10 kg), cow urine (10 L), jaggery (2 kg), pulse flour (2 kg), and handful of soil from bund in 200 L water. Fermented for 48 hours. Applied through irrigation at 200 L/acre.
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts - promoted under PKVY scheme

farming_practices.name: Neem-Based Pest Management
farming_practices.description: Using neem in multiple forms: Neem oil (3-5%), neem seed kernel extract (NSKE 5%), neem cake (200 kg/acre in soil), and neem-coated urea. Effective against 200+ insect pest species. Safe for beneficial insects.
benefits: Effective against wide range of pests
Safe for natural enemies and pollinators
Neem cake also works as fertilizer
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Panchagavya Application
farming_practices.description: Preparing Panchagavya from five cow products (dung, urine, milk, curd, ghee) plus jaggery, banana, and coconut water. Fermented for 21 days. Spray at 3% concentration or apply through drip at 50 L/acre.
benefits: Enhances resistance to pests and diseases
Low cost and easy to prepare
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Composting Crop Residues (Instead of Burning)
farming_practices.description: Converting rice straw, cotton stalks, and other crop residues into compost using decomposing culture (Trichoderma + PROM). Takes 60-90 days. Avoids air pollution from burning and returns nutrients to soil.
benefits: Prevents air pollution from stubble burning
Returns nutrients and organic matter to soil
Government penalty for burning crop residues
Trichoderma culture available free from KVK
farming_practices.season: Post-harvest (November-January for Kharif, April-May for Rabi)
farming_practices.region: Rice and cotton areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Zinc Application in Rice
farming_practices.description: Applying zinc sulphate at 10 kg/acre as basal or 0.5% foliar spray at tillering and panicle initiation. Zinc deficiency is widespread in Telangana paddy soils, causing reduced tillering and poor grain filling.
benefits: Corrects widespread zinc deficiency in Telangana
farming_practices.season: During rice transplanting and active growth
farming_practices.region: All Telangana rice-growing areas, especially Warangal, Nizamabad

farming_practices.name: Fertigation in Drip Irrigation
farming_practices.description: Applying water-soluble fertilizers through drip irrigation system. Nutrients delivered directly to root zone. Ideal for chilli, turmeric, vegetables, and fruit crops. Reduces fertilizer use by 25-30%.
farming_practices.region: Areas with drip irrigation systems across Telangana

farming_practices.name: Biofertilizer Application (Rhizobium + PSB)
farming_practices.description: Seed treatment with Rhizobium culture for legumes (red gram, bengal gram, groundnut, soybean) and Phosphate Solubilizing Bacteria (PSB) for all crops. Available from PJTSAU and KVKs in Telangana.
benefits: Available free or at subsidized rates from KVK
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts - available from 31 KVKs

farming_practices.name: Foliar Spray of DAP and Micronutrients
farming_practices.description: Spraying 2% DAP (di-ammonium phosphate) + micronutrient mixture (containing Zn, B, Fe, Mn) during critical growth stages. Cost-effective way to correct hidden hunger and boost yield in nutrient-deficient Telangana soils.
benefits: Effective when root uptake is limited
farming_practices.season: At flowering and grain filling stages
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Integrated Weed Management in Rice
farming_practices.description: Combining pre-emergence herbicide (Pretilachlor or Butachlor at 3 days after transplanting), one hand weeding at 25-30 DAT, and maintaining 5 cm standing water. Reduces weed competition by 85-90%.
benefits: Saves 15-20 labor days per acre vs hand weeding alone
Cost-effective compared to manual weeding only
Integrates cultural, chemical, and manual methods
farming_practices.region: All rice-growing areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Stale Seed Bed Technique
farming_practices.description: Preparing the field 15-20 days before sowing, irrigating to germinate weed seeds, then killing emerged weeds with Paraquat or shallow cultivation. Reduces weed population by 50-60% in the main crop.
benefits: Especially useful for problematic weedy fields
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Mechanical Weeding with Power Weeder
farming_practices.description: Using power weeder or cono-weeder in row crops for inter-row weed control. Efficient and reduces labor dependency. Custom Hiring Centers (CHCs) under government scheme provide equipment on rental.
benefits: Saves 50-60% labor cost vs hand weeding
Subsidy available on purchase under SMAM
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Proper Drying of Grains
farming_practices.description: Drying harvested rice, maize, and pulses to safe moisture levels (12-14% for rice, 12% for maize, 10% for pulses) on clean threshing floors or using mechanical dryers. Prevents storage losses and aflatoxin contamination.
benefits: Prevents grain spoilage and mold growth
Reduces weight loss in storage by 5-10%
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Combine Harvester for Rice and Wheat
farming_practices.description: Using combine harvester for timely harvesting of rice and wheat. Reduces harvest losses from 5-7% (manual) to 2-3%. Custom hiring available at Rs 1500-2000/acre. Critical during labor shortage periods.
benefits: Combined operation of cutting and threshing
farming_practices.region: Rice-growing areas: Warangal, Nizamabad, Karimnagar, Khammam

farming_practices.name: Grading and Sorting Before Sale
farming_practices.description: Cleaning, grading and sorting produce before taking to mandi. Chilli graded by size and color, turmeric by finger/bulb, groundnut by grade. Graded produce fetches 10-20% premium over ungraded lot.
benefits: Easier to meet e-NAM quality standards
farming_practices.region: All Telangana mandis

farming_practices.name: Scientific Storage in Hermetic Bags
farming_practices.description: Storing grains and pulses in triple-layer hermetic storage bags (like Purdue Improved Crop Storage - PICS bags). Creates airtight environment that kills storage pests without chemicals. One bag stores 50-100 kg.
benefits: Zero chemical storage - safe for consumption
Kills storage insects through oxygen depletion
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Recommended Rice Varieties for Telangana
farming_practices.description: Selecting PJTSAU-recommended rice varieties: RNR 15048 (Telangana Sona) for fine grain, KNM 118 for high yield, JGL 11470 for early duration, Bathukamma for medium-late. Match variety to season, soil, and irrigation availability.
benefits: Suitable grain quality for local market
farming_practices.region: All rice-growing areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Recommended Cotton Varieties for Telangana
farming_practices.description: Selecting approved Bt cotton hybrids for Telangana conditions. BGII hybrids with bollworm resistance. Consider fiber quality (staple length > 28mm), ginning outturn, and disease resistance. Consult PJTSAU recommendations.
benefits: Higher lint quality for better price
Adapted to local soil and climate
farming_practices.region: Cotton-growing areas: Adilabad, Khammam, Nalgonda, Warangal

farming_practices.name: Short-Duration Varieties for Dryland Areas
farming_practices.description: Using short-duration (90-120 day) varieties of red gram, sorghum, and millets for rainfed dryland areas of Telangana. These varieties mature before moisture stress sets in and allow double cropping.
benefits: More reliable yield in rainfed conditions
farming_practices.region: Dryland areas: Mahbubnagar, Nagarkurnool, Wanaparthy, Jogulamba Gadwal

farming_practices.name: Laser Land Leveling
farming_practices.description: Using laser-guided land leveler to achieve precise field leveling. Improves water distribution uniformity, saves 20-25% irrigation water, and improves crop stand. Available on custom hiring from CHCs.
farming_practices.region: All irrigated areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Zero Tillage for Rabi Crops
farming_practices.description: Sowing rabi crops (wheat, chickpea, mustard) directly into rice stubble without ploughing using zero-till seed drill. Saves time, fuel, and moisture. Allows timely sowing after delayed rice harvest.
benefits: Retains soil moisture for better germination
Available on custom hire from CHCs
farming_practices.region: Rice-wheat/chickpea areas: Nizamabad, Karimnagar, Adilabad

farming_practices.name: Drone Spraying for Pest Control
farming_practices.description: Using agricultural drones for pesticide and fertilizer spraying. Covers 8-10 acres per hour compared to 1 acre by manual sprayer. Reduces chemical exposure to farmers. Custom hiring services now available in Telangana.
benefits: Can spray in tall crops like sugarcane
farming_practices.region: Emerging practice across Telangana, available in progressive farming areas

farming_practices.name: Polyhouse Vegetable Cultivation
farming_practices.description: Growing high-value vegetables (capsicum, cucumber, tomato) in polyhouse/greenhouse structures. Government provides 50% subsidy under NHM. Year-round production with 3-5x higher yield per unit area than open field.
farming_practices.region: Peri-urban areas near Hyderabad, Warangal, Karimnagar

farming_practices.name: Shade Net for Nursery Raising
farming_practices.description: Using 50% shade net for raising healthy vegetable seedlings (tomato, chilli, brinjal, cabbage, cauliflower) in pro-trays with cocopeat medium. Produces uniform, disease-free transplants.
benefits: Protection from heavy rain and sun
Better crop stand and early maturity
farming_practices.region: All vegetable-growing areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Turmeric as Intercrop in Mango Orchards
farming_practices.description: Growing turmeric as intercrop in young mango orchards (1-6 years) utilizing the space between trees. Provides income during non-bearing years. Turmeric thrives in partial shade and benefits from mango tree windbreak.
farming_practices.region: Mango-growing areas: Rangareddy, Mahbubnagar, Medak

farming_practices.name: Integrated Farming System
farming_practices.description: Combining crop cultivation with dairy (2-3 cows), poultry (100-200 birds), fish culture (farm pond), vermicompost unit, and kitchen garden on a 2-5 acre holding. Waste from one component becomes input for another.
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts, especially small and marginal farmers

farming_practices.name: Millets Promotion (Nutri-Cereals)
farming_practices.description: Growing millets like jowar, bajra, foxtail millet, and finger millet in dryland areas. Growing demand as health food. Government promoting under National Millet Mission. Good for dryland Telangana with low water requirement.
benefits: Low water requirement (200-350 mm rainfall sufficient)
Growing market demand as health food
Government procurement and support under Millet Mission
farming_practices.region: Dryland areas: Mahbubnagar, Nagarkurnool, Adilabad

farming_practices.name: Contingency Crop Planning for Delayed Monsoon
farming_practices.description: Having backup crop plan if monsoon is delayed. If normal sowing window missed, switch to short-duration crops. E.g., if cotton sowing delayed beyond July 15, switch to maize or sunflower. PJTSAU issues contingency advisories.
benefits: Avoids total crop loss from delayed monsoon
Based on scientific recommendations from PJTSAU
Ensures some harvest even in poor rainfall years
farming_practices.region: All rainfed areas of Telangana

farming_practices.name: Conservation Agriculture (Minimum Tillage + Residue Retention)
farming_practices.description: Three principles: minimum soil disturbance, permanent soil cover with crop residues, and crop rotation. Builds soil organic carbon, conserves moisture, and makes farming more resilient to climate variability.
benefits: Builds soil organic carbon over time
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts, especially dryland areas

farming_practices.name: Crop Insurance under PMFBY
farming_practices.description: Enrolling in Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana through bank or CSC within notification period. Premium: 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi. Covers yield loss from drought, flood, pest, and disease. Mandatory for crop loan borrowers.
benefits: Available for all notified crops in Telangana
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts for notified crops

farming_practices.name: Selling Through e-NAM (Electronic National Agriculture Market)
farming_practices.description: Registering on e-NAM portal and selling produce through electronic auction at registered mandis. Provides price transparency, wider buyer base, and competitive bidding. Active mandis in Telangana: Warangal, Nizamabad, Karimnagar, etc.
farming_practices.season: During marketing of any agricultural produce
farming_practices.region: All e-NAM registered mandis in Telangana

farming_practices.name: Farmer Producer Organization (FPO) for Collective Marketing
farming_practices.description: Joining or forming a Farmer Producer Organization (FPO) for collective procurement of inputs and marketing of produce. Improves bargaining power. Government provides financial support of Rs 18 lakh per FPO.
benefits: Bulk purchase of inputs at lower cost
Government support of Rs 18 lakh per FPO
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts - over 500 FPOs registered

farming_practices.name: Warehouse Receipt Finance
farming_practices.description: Storing produce in government-registered warehouse and getting loan (up to 70% of value) against warehouse receipt. Allows farmers to wait for better prices without distress selling. Available through cooperative and commercial banks.
benefits: Avoids distress selling at harvest glut
Loan against stored produce for immediate cash needs
Interest rate subsidized for small farmers
farming_practices.region: All districts with registered warehouses

farming_practices.name: Using Crop Advisory Apps
farming_practices.description: Using mobile apps like PJTSAU Crop Advisory, Kissan Call Center (1800-180-1551), and IFFCO Kisan for real-time crop advisories, weather alerts, market prices, and expert consultation in Telangana.
benefits: Weather-based alerts for spraying and harvesting
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts

farming_practices.name: Soil Health Card Based Nutrient Management
farming_practices.description: Using Soil Health Card recommendations for precise fertilizer application. Each card provides field-specific nutrient recommendations for 6 nutrients (N, P, K, S, Zn, B). Cards issued every 2 years by government.
farming_practices.region: All Telangana districts
